WHY THE SAC IS RELEVANT:  
  
Fires was traditionally played in the context of efficient, undercosted, BIG creature threats like [Blastoderm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blastoderm) (![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol) for 5 power) or [Shivan Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shivan Wurm) (![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol) for 7 power). Or cards like [Saproling Burst](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Saproling Burst), which net you 12 damage for 5 mana when the tokens have haste.  
  
You're probably thinking that 5 damage on turn 3 followed by 17 on turn 4 will get you there. This is generally the case (or the fix, as it was called), but Fires doesn't always get those kinds of draws. The thing that enables a total shut-out in a strong matchup where the opponent is capable of neutralizing some of these threats quickly is the extra 2 points of damage. It's that extra 2 damage that pushes it over the edge, even if its on a lone [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise) flying over their team.
